title: Speak to the School
description: Have a conversation with the school to express concerns about uniform policies and support for transgender students.

title: Speak to your GP
description: Your family doctor can provide referrals and medical support for gender-affirming care.

title: Consider making a Formal Complaint
description: Use the school's formal complaints procedure to raise issues officially.

title: Consider contacting CAMHS
description: NHS service supporting children with emotional and mental health difficulties.

title: Contact your Local Council Safeguarding Team
description: Contact your local council's safeguarding team if a child is at risk or not being supported appropriately.

title: MASH (Multi-Agency Safeguarding Hub)
description: Coordinates responses from social care, education, and police when a child is at risk.

title: Ask for a Social Worker
description: Request a social worker to assess the situation if a child's rights or wellbeing are being compromised.

title: LADO (Local Authority Designated Officer)
description: Handles concerns about adults working with children, especially in schools or institutions.

title: Ofsted
description: File a complaint about school practices that violate safeguarding or equality obligations.

title: Gendered Intelligence
description: Supports young trans people through youth groups, resources, and educational outreach.

title: TransActual UK
description: Run by and for trans people, advocating for rights, healthcare access, and legal protection.

title: Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS)
description: Provides advice on discrimination and human rights issues.

title: YoungMinds
description: Mental health support and resources for young people and families.

title: Mermaids
description: Supports transgender, nonbinary, and gender-diverse young people and their families.

title: Stonewall
description: Advocates for LGBTQ+ equality in schools, workplaces, and communities.

title: Just Like Us
description: Empowers LGBTQ+ young people through school-based inclusion and ambassador programmes.

title: Galop
description: Support and advocacy for LGBTQ+ people facing abuse, hate crime, or discrimination.

title: The Proud Trust
description: Youth work and resources for LGBTQ+ young people and educators.

title: Contact Your MP
description: Raise the issue with your local Member of Parliament for support or advocacy.
